verses.verse: Now <WH4994> will I sing <WH7891> to my well-beloved <WH3039> a song <WH7892> of my beloved <WH1730> touching his vineyard. <WH3754> My well-beloved <WH3039> hath <WH1961> a vineyard <WH3754> in a very fruitful hill: <WH1121> <WH8081> <WH7161>

And he fenced <WH5823> it, and gathered out the stones <WH5619> thereof, and planted <WH5193> it with the choicest vine, <WH8321> and built <WH1129> a tower <WH4026> in the midst <WH8432> of it, and also <WH1571> made <WH2672> a winepress <WH3342> therein: and he looked <WH6960> that it should bring forth <WH6213> grapes, <WH6025> and it brought forth <WH6213> wild grapes. <WH891>
And now, <WH6258> O inhabitants <WH3427> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> and men <WH376> of Judah, <WH3063> judge, <WH8199> I pray you, <WH4994> between <WH996> me and my vineyard. <WH3754>

What <WH4100> could have been done <WH6213> more <WH5750> to my vineyard, <WH3754> that I have not <WH3808> done <WH6213> in it? wherefore, <WH4069> when I looked <WH6960> that it should bring forth <WH6213> grapes, <WH6025> brought it forth <WH6213> wild grapes? <WH891>

And now <WH6258> go to; I will tell <WH3045> <WH4994> you <WH853> what <WH834> I <WH589> will do <WH6213> to my vineyard: <WH3754> I will take away <WH5493> the hedge <WH4881> thereof, and it shall be <WH1961> eaten up; <WH1197> and break down <WH6555> the wall <WH1447> thereof, and it shall be <WH1961> trodden down: <WH4823>

And I will lay <WH7896> it waste: <WH1326> it shall not <WH3808> be pruned, <WH2167> nor <WH3808> digged; <WH5737> but there shall come up <WH5927> briers <WH8068> and thorns: <WH7898> I will also command <WH6680> <WH5921> the clouds <WH5645> that they rain no rain <WH4480> <WH4305> <WH4306> upon <WH5921> it.

For <WH3588> the vineyard <WH3754> of the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> is the house <WH1004> of Israel, <WH3478> and the men <WH376> of Judah <WH3063> his pleasant <WH8191> plant: <WH5194> and he looked <WH6960> for judgment, <WH4941> but behold <WH2009> oppression; <WH4939> for righteousness, <WH6666> but behold <WH2009> a cry. <WH6818>

Woe <WH1945> unto them that join <WH5060> house <WH1004> to house, <WH1004> that lay <WH7126> field <WH7704> to field, <WH7704> till <WH5704> there be no <WH657> place, <WH4725> that they may be placed <WH3427> alone <WH905> in the midst <WH7130> of the earth! <WH776>

In mine ears <WH241> said the LORD <WH3068> of hosts, <WH6635> Of a truth <WH518> <WH3808> many <WH7227> houses <WH1004> shall be <WH1961> desolate, <WH8047> even great <WH1419> and fair, <WH2896> without <WH4480> <WH369> inhabitant. <WH3427>
Yea, <WH3588> ten <WH6235> acres <WH6776> of vineyard <WH3754> shall yield <WH6213> one <WH259> bath, <WH1324> and the seed <WH2233> of a homer <WH2563> shall yield <WH6213> an ephah. <WH374>

Woe <WH1945> unto them that rise up early <WH7925> in the morning, <WH1242> that they may follow <WH7291> strong drink; <WH7941> that continue <WH309> until night, <WH5399> till wine <WH3196> inflame <WH1814> them!

And the harp, <WH3658> and the viol, <WH5035> the tabret, <WH8596> and pipe, <WH2485> and wine, <WH3196> are <WH1961> in their feasts: <WH4960> but they regard <WH5027> not <WH3808> the work <WH6467> of the LORD, <WH3068> neither <WH3808> consider <WH7200> the operation <WH4639> of his hands. <WH3027>

Therefore <WH3651> my people <WH5971> are gone into captivity, <WH1540> because they have no <WH4480> <WH1097> knowledge: <WH1847> and their honorable <WH3519> men <WH4962> are famished, <WH7458> and their multitude <WH1995> dried up <WH6704> with thirst. <WH6772>

Therefore <WH3651> hell <WH7585> hath enlarged <WH7337> herself, <WH5315> and opened <WH6473> her mouth <WH6310> without <WH1097> measure: <WH2706> and their glory, <WH1926> and their multitude, <WH1995> and their pomp, <WH7588> and he that rejoiceth, <WH5938> shall descend <WH3381> into it.
And the mean man <WH120> shall be brought down, <WH7817> and the mighty man <WH376> shall be humbled, <WH8213> and the eyes <WH5869> of the lofty <WH1364> shall be humbled: <WH8213>
But the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> shall be exalted <WH1361> in judgment, <WH4941> and God <WH410> that is holy <WH6918> shall be sanctified <WH6942> in righteousness. <WH6666>
Then shall the lambs <WH3532> feed <WH7462> after their manner, <WH1699> and the waste places <WH2723> of the fat ones <WH4220> shall strangers <WH1481> eat. <WH398>
Woe <WH1945> unto them that draw <WH4900> iniquity <WH5771> with cords <WH2256> of vanity, <WH7723> and sin <WH2402> as it were with a cart <WH5699> rope: <WH5688>

That say, <WH559> Let him make speed, <WH4116> and hasten <WH2363> his work, <WH4639> that <WH4616> we may see <WH7200> it: and let the counsel <WH6098> of the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478> draw nigh <WH7126> and come, <WH935> that we may know <WH3045> it!

Woe <WH1945> unto them that call <WH559> evil <WH7451> good, <WH2896> and good <WH2896> evil; <WH7451> that put <WH7760> darkness <WH2822> for light, <WH216> and light <WH216> for darkness; <WH2822> that put <WH7760> bitter <WH4751> for sweet, <WH4966> and sweet <WH4966> for bitter! <WH4751>
Woe <WH1945> unto them that are wise <WH2450> in their own eyes, <WH5869> and prudent <WH995> in <WH5048> their own sight! <WH6440>
Woe <WH1945> unto them that are mighty <WH1368> to drink <WH8354> wine, <WH3196> and men <WH376> of strength <WH2428> to mingle <WH4537> strong drink: <WH7941>
Which justify <WH6663> the wicked <WH7563> for <WH6118> reward, <WH7810> and take away <WH5493> the righteousness <WH6666> of the righteous <WH6662> from <WH4480> him!

Therefore <WH3651> as the fire <WH784> devoureth <WH398> the stubble, <WH7179> and the flame <WH3852> consumeth <WH7503> the chaff, <WH2842> so their root <WH8328> shall be <WH1961> as rottenness, <WH4716> and their blossom <WH6525> shall go up <WH5927> as dust: <WH80> because <WH3588> they have cast away <WH3988> <WH853> the law <WH8451> of the LORD <WH3068> of hosts, <WH6635> and despised <WH5006> the word <WH565> of the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel. <WH3478>

Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> is the anger <WH639> of the LORD <WH3068> kindled <WH2734> against his people, <WH5971> and he hath stretched forth <WH5186> his hand <WH3027> against <WH5921> them, and hath smitten <WH5221> them: and the hills <WH2022> did tremble, <WH7264> and their carcasses <WH5038> were torn <WH1961> <WH5478> in the midst <WH7130> of the streets. <WH2351> For all <WH3605> this <WH2063> his anger <WH639> is not <WH3808> turned away, <WH7725> but his hand <WH3027> is stretched out <WH5186> still. <WH5750>

And he will lift up <WH5375> an ensign <WH5251> to the nations <WH1471> from far, <WH4480> <WH7350> and will hiss <WH8319> unto them from the end <WH4480> <WH7097> of the earth: <WH776> and, behold, <WH2009> they shall come <WH935> with speed <WH4120> swiftly: <WH7031>

None <WH369> shall be weary <WH5889> nor <WH369> stumble <WH3782> among them; none <WH3808> shall slumber <WH5123> nor <WH3808> sleep; <WH3462> neither <WH3808> shall the girdle <WH232> of their loins <WH2504> be loosed, <WH6605> nor <WH3808> the latchet <WH8288> of their shoes <WH5275> be broken: <WH5423>

Whose <WH834> arrows <WH2671> are sharp, <WH8150> and all <WH3605> their bows <WH7198> bent, <WH1869> their horses' <WH5483> hooves <WH6541> shall be counted <WH2803> like flint, <WH6864> and their wheels <WH1534> like a whirlwind: <WH5492>

Their roaring <WH7581> shall be like a lion, <WH3833> they shall roar <WH7580> like young lions: <WH3715> yea, they shall roar, <WH5098> and lay hold <WH270> of the prey, <WH2964> and shall carry it away safe, <WH6403> and none <WH369> shall deliver <WH5337> it.

And in that <WH1931> day <WH3117> they shall roar <WH5098> against <WH5921> them like the roaring <WH5100> of the sea: <WH3220> and if one look <WH5027> unto the land, <WH776> behold <WH2009> darkness <WH2822> and sorrow, <WH6862> and the light <WH216> is darkened <WH2821> in the heavens <WH6183> thereof.
